definition.en: The profile for the trinity education application CATCH
A learning path within the EPISD Dual Language Competency Framework

name.en: Planning and Preparation for DLE Teaching and Learning

description.en: The planning and preparation for DLE teaching and learning domain as described by the EPISD Dual Language Competency Framework
The dual language education environment domain as described by the EPISD Dual Language Competency Framework
The professional responsibilities learning path as described by the EPISD Dual Language Competency Framework

definition.en: A collection of activities which repserent skills required within the workplace as described within the EPISD Dual Language Competency Framework

name.en: DLE Research, Goals, Models, and Benifits

description.en: The DLE Research, Goals, Models, and Benefits competency as described by the EPISD Dual Language Competency Framework
The two-way sheltered instruction competency as described by the EPISD Dual Language Competency Framework
The cross linguistic connections competency as described by the EPISD Dual Language Competency Framework
The utilizing dual language resources competency as described by the EPISD Dual Language Competency Framework

name.en: Cultural Awareness in the Dual Language Classroom

description.en: The cultural awareness in the dual language classroom competency as described by the EPISD Dual Language Competency Framework

name.en: Engagement of the Dual Language Family

description.en: The engagement of the dual language family competency as described by the EPISD Dual Language Competency Framework

name.en: Community Engagement in the Dual Language Classroom

description.en: The community engagement in the dual language classroom competency as described by the EPISD Dual Language Competency Framework

definition.en: leading a discussion at an advocacy event
Indicates that the actor has sent the object to a dual language family.
supplying a link to an online resource
Uploading a resource from a local file system
The actor has clicked the submit or save button within the CATCH application
To provide a reflection about an activity or piece of content within the CATCH application
To read a research article
to complete the process of viewing, reading and optionally reflecting on a article within the catch application
An activity in which the learner reports progression.
An activity where a learner reads an article and optionally provides a reflection on that article.

Represents objects such as news articles, knowledge base entries, or other similar construct. Such objects generally consist of paragraphs of text, in some cases incorporating embedded media such as photos and inline hyperlinks to other resources.
a Lesson plan is a document which outlines activities which happen in the classroom
A activity in which something is provided to validate the claim being made within an activity
An in-person professional development event. These types of activites are created from the information the learner provides about the event.
An in-person dual language advocacy event. These types of activites are created from the information the learner provides about the event.
This activity type describes a teacher engaging with a family/parent/community in some way on a given date.

name.en: Submit a lesson plan and resources
Submit a lesson plan with evidence
Lesson Plan - Submit Lesson Plan incorporating culture.
Evidence - Demonstrate how learner communicates with families
Lesson Plans - Submit lesson plans and evidence
Evidence - Provide examples of communication to parents

definition.en: The fields of a Lesson Plan template filled in by the learner
the Standards for a provided or designed lesson plan
Criteria for demonstrating communication with families.  The selected check boxes
The date range (as a string) a schedule covers

prefLabel.en: meta data about an advocacy event

definition.en: the type and audience for an advocacy event.
Documents which provide aditional information about the lesson plan. Can be instructions for lesson plan execution, demonstrating implementation or any other documents related to the lesson plan
A survey provided to the parent(s) of a DL student
The results of the survey provided to the parent(s) of a DL student

scopeNote.en: this states the the statement conforms to this profile
the total number of points awarded.  This value will be determined by the point values associated with the various criteria
the lowest possible number of points
the greatest possible number of points
should be true if the score threshold was met, false otherwise
the mentors feedback

an array of objects where each object represents one of the criteria being scored.  each object will have a property for the name of the criteria, the possible values (ie. Emerging, Attainment, Excellence) and the selected value.
the time when the mentor submited the scored rubric

definition.en: This template is for statements that are the result of a mentor reviewing and scoring somthing within the catch application.

scopeNote.en: The timestamp when the learner viewed the rubric
this states the the statement conforms to this profile

definition.en: this statement template should be used whenever a learner clicks on the drop down button to view a scoring rubric within the catch application.  This is possible within many different types of activities and will show up in every pattern in which an activity includes a rubric.  This is a simple statement of actor viewed rubric in some activity

scopeNote.en: this is activity specific.  Most of the time it will be when the submission of the updated document happens.
the different types of activities within the CATCH application.  Select the one appropriate to the completed activity
this should be the name of the activity
this states the the statement conforms to this profile

definition.en: This template is for when a learner needs to go back and rework a resource due to not meeting a score threshold.  This statement should come before/at the same time as the second submit statement for a given object.

scopeNote.en: When the learner returns to the activity page
The name of the thing being reflected upon
The statement about the object being reflected on. Should be the submitted statement.
this is the reflection if entered by the learner
this states the the statement conforms to this profile

definition.en: This template is for a learner providing a reflection about a piece of content or activity within the CATCH application.

scopeNote.en: The object is the user recieving the notification
the time when the system notified the user
should be true if the submission was successful, false otherwise
this states the the statement conforms to this profile
A statement refrence to the submission statement the system is responding to

definition.en: The system notifies the user that a submission was (not)successfuly recieved

scopeNote.en: The object is the user recieving the notification
the time when the system notified the user
the number of submissions made so far
Should be 0 in almost all cases
the threshold which determines completion
this states the the statement conforms to this profile
A statement refrence to the system submission confirmation statement generated by the statement template https://w3id.org/xapi/catch/templates#system-notification-submission

definition.en: The system notifies the user on their progression through an activity after a successful submission

scopeNote.en: The object is the user recieving the notification
the time when the system notified the user
should be true to indicate completion
this states the the statement conforms to this profile
A statement refrence to the submission statement the system is responding to

definition.en: The system notifies the user that they have completed an activity

scopeNote.en: The object is the thing submitted by the user.  All properties of the object should be contained within these statements
the time when the system updated the status
should be 'Needs Work'
this states the the statement conforms to this profile
A statement refrence to the scoring of the submited object

definition.en: The system updates the status of a submission to needs work

scopeNote.en: The object is the thing submitted by the user.  All properties of the object should be contained within these statements
the time when the system updated the status
should be 'In Review'
this states the the statement conforms to this profile
A statement refrence to the scoring of the submited object

definition.en: The system updates the status of a submission to in review

scopeNote.en: The object is the thing submitted by the user.  All properties of the object should be contained within these statements
the time when the system updated the status
should be 'Complete'
this states the the statement conforms to this profile
A statement refrence to the scoring of the submited object

definition.en: The system updates the status of a submission to complete

scopeNote.en: The user being notified.  Could be a teacher or a mentor based on the context
the time when the system notified the user
The message displayed to the user
this states the the statement conforms to this profile
A statement refrence to the statement the system is responding to

definition.en: The system provides a status report to the user.  The progress is reported in the form of a score xAPI object and the activity the user was progressing through is represented by the contextActivities ids.

scopeNote.en: this is activity specific.  Most of the time it will be when the final submission was made by the teacher
the different types of activities within the CATCH application.  Select the one appropriate to the completed activity
this should be the name of the activity.  ie. Check-in Existing PD Activity
this should be the description of the Activity.  ie. The teacher attended 3 existing PD events
this should be the id of the activity completed.  as of now, that id consists of .../catch/activities/{certification}/{domain}/{competency}/{activity-type}/{activity-name}
this states the the statement conforms to this profile

definition.en: This template is for generating statements indicating that an activity was completed.  Fires off after a pattern of activity specific statements occurs measured via a threshold.

scopeNote.en: The timestamp when the learner viewed the rubric
this states the the statement conforms to this profile

definition.en: The description, purpose and usage of this template
The description, purpose and usage of this template

scopeNote.en: The timestamp when the learner viewed the rubric
this states the the statement conforms to this profile
the time when the learner clicked upload doc
The name of the file or some subset of the full file name.
The description of the lesson plan if avialable. This would be the text entered into the field labeled Activity: Describe your lesson...

An array of objects which contain the information about the State standards covered by the lesson plan.  each object should contain the subject, grade, strand and expectations if avialable.  This field will not be present in the case of uploading an original document where state standards dont apply or aren't known.
The users file system.  This is implied by the verb upload but may be beneficial to have in the statement.  If its used, it should be used in all statements which match this template
this states the the statement conforms to this profile

definition.en: This template is for statements when the learner uploaded a lesson plan instead of designing one.  The uploaded lesson plan should be one designed by the teacher.

scopeNote.en: When the learner clicks create lesson plan button
the name of the lesson plan.  The title field within the template
The description of the lesson plan if avialable. This would be the text entered into the field labeled Activity: Describe your lesson... when the object is an adapted lesson plan

The meta data from the filled out template.  Some of the fields from the template are used in other places in an xAPI statement.  This extension is for the fields that don't naturally fit into existing xAPI fields.
An array of objects which contain the information about the State standards covered by the lesson plan.  each object should contain the subject, grade, strand and expectations if avialable.
this states the the statement conforms to this profile

definition.en: This template is for statements regarding the learner reaching out to families in some way.  The object's name will be the provided type in activity f4.2.01.  Each type of communication should have a unique IRI associated with it so patterns of how teachers communicate can easily be established. ie. when the type is email, that has a unique id vs flyer has its own unique identifier across all teachers.  If multiple types are supplied, the IRI should be based off of the first type entered, the one used for the object name.

This is a pattern for someone writing a reflection
Designing from a template or uploading a lesson plan

the system updates an activity to be in-review or needs work
matches if there is an incomplete activity or a succssful activity.  Needed to allow for multiple attemps and a definite conclusion.

one interaton of optionally viewing a rubric, uploading or designing a lesson plan, optionally writing a reflection and then submitting the lesson paln for mentor review.

one interaton of optionally viewing a rubric, uploading or designing a lesson plan, optionally writing a reflection and then submitting the lesson paln for mentor review.  this iteration, m3-3-01 and m1.2.01 do not have a seperate statement for uploading supporing documents, these uploads are attached to the submission statement as an attachment.  If this inconsistency causes an issue, the templats can be changed to have an upload statement which gets refrenced by the lesson plan submission statement.  That change will cause a minor disconnect between the lesson plan and the supporting documents and will add an aditional step to get to the supporting material.  If more explanation on this decision is necessary, I can go into more specific rational.

prefLabel.en: scoring submitted lesson plan and resources

definition.en: The learner submitting a lesson plan and resources and then the mentor scoring it.  accounts for the possibility of not a successful score.

The learner has reached the score threshold necessary for completion

one interaton of optionally viewing a rubric, uploading or designing a lesson plan, optionally writing a reflection and then submitting the lesson paln for mentor review.  this iteration, m3-2-01 and m1.2.01 do not have a seperate statement for uploading supporing documents, these uploads are attached to the submission statement as an attachment.  If this inconsistency causes an issue, the templats can be changed to have an upload statement which gets refrenced by the lesson plan submission statement.  That change will cause a minor disconnect between the lesson plan and the supporting documents and will add an aditional step to get to the supporting material.  If more explanation on this decision is necessary, I can go into more specific rational.
